The kitchen boasts butcher block countertops and stainless steel appliances, including a high-end Bertazzoni gas range. Custom dining room shelving is also included. The ADU can continue to supplement the mortgage as a rental or serve as an in-law's quarter. The insulated garage below the ADU has plenty of shelving and storage and is plumbed for in-floor heating.The basement includes two fully drywalled rooms with closets that were used as home offices and a half bathroom that could be adapted to include a formal bathroom. This property boasts a spacious and well-manicured backyard that is fully fenced, and includes a putting green on the side yard for added entertainment. A new Trex deck has been installed, offering a great spot for summer BBQs or lounging in the evening. Enjoy a cup of coffee on the cozy front porch, which provides the perfect place to start the day. Additionally, a brand new roof was recently installed in April. Take a stroll to Cathedral Park, the waterfront and the downtown St. John's shops, restaurants and bars. Public Remarks: Unicorn alert!  Located on a quiet street in St Johns is a solid craftsman farmhouse on a magical .68 acre lot.  This is a rare opportunity to create a true urban homestead in the middle of the city while being blocks away from shops, restaurants, and incredible parks.  The beautiful 1914 home retains its original charm, with a grand front porch leading to a spacious living and dining room with original millwork and wood floors, plus a newer permitted woodstove for cozy evenings by the fire.  The kitchen features original handmade cabinetry with updated appliances and an open passthrough for flow to the dining space.  There is a main floor bedroom and bath as well as a spacious sun porch that could be used as a guest space.  Upstairs, find a large common area with two additional bedrooms, a bathroom, and a bonus room that could be a fourth bedroom or home office with access to a rooftop deck.  The unfinished basement offers plenty of storage and workspace.  The house is special, but the real showstopper here is the property itself: there are so many nooks and crannies to explore, including an oversized shop, a private Airstream area with an outdoor bathroom complete with ADA accessible shower, a Cob-style pizza oven, extensive gardens, an alpaca enclosure, and so much more.  For the development minded, the property is zoned R5 and could potentially accommodate a small subdivision with the Residential Infill Project allowances (buyer to do due diligence), or work the land to create the urban farm of your dreams as there is plenty of space to spread out and play.

The laundry room, a full bathroom, 2nd bedroom, and roomy central landing near the stairs complete the second floor, while the 3rd floor's spacious loft and large closet provide a bright, flexible space for work, school, exercise, or guests. This peaceful street sits just 2 blocks from a grocery store, hardware store, library, and gym. Another 3 blocks and you're at the cafes, pubs, and shops of the main drag through St. John's. Walk down to iconic Cathedral City Park to stroll the banks of the Willamette River and enjoy the Portland Jazz Festival or bike to Pier Park for some disc golf. Just across the river, Forest Park awaits. Enjoy a car-free, small-town lifestyle just 15 minutes from downtown Portland and 20 minutes from the international airport.In the best walkable neighborhoods, homes with attached garages are an increasingly rare find - don't let this one get away!

Rooftop solar panels were installed in 2022 to offset electrical expenses (the July PGE bill was only $15.91). This home has a radon mitigation system, plus the oil tank was decommissioned in 2007, and the owners had the sewer scoped in February, to which it passed (both reports are provided in the Seller Property Disclosures). Approach through the front garden showcasing a variety of roses, hydrangeas, boxwoods, evergreens + other vibrant perennials. The impressive covered front porch leads to the entryway which is a landing space to kick off your shoes + hang your coat (particularly after a rainy PNW day) before entering the living room framed by interior columns. You'll also find a full bathroom perfect for guests + a laundry room w/ built-in storage + a door leading to the garden. Upstairs, all three bedrooms feature fir flooring + roomy closets. The showstopper upstairs bathroom has a luxe marble vanity, hex tile flooring, clawfoot soaking tub + walk-in shower w/ a marble bench. Downstairs, the unfinished basement w/ a separate entrance provides an abundance of storage space and/or opportunity to add equity by taking it to the next level. SO many possibilities! The fully-fenced backyard features raised garden beds, a fig tree, lilac tree, magnolia tree + a spacious grassy area for your furry friend to play, or for you to further cultivate! Incredible location close to New Seasons, food trucks, breweries, parks + all that North Portland has to offer.

Public Remarks: Welcome to this hip mid-century 2 level ranch nestled in St Johns, an absolute gardener's delight! Built in 1951, this home offers 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a proper dining room and a finished downstairs with a retro bar; plenty of room to live large! Hardwood floors run throughout the upper level, classic coved ceilings and large picture windows adorn the upstairs. The large living room features a brick fireplace and opens to a proper dining room. The kitchen is dreamy with a new professional 6-burner Kutch gas range and hood, subway tile, new flooring and countertops, and a breakfast area. A glass slider leads to the backyard oasis. Two bright and roomy bedrooms and a tiled bathroom with new flooring complete the upstairs. The large finished downstairs is SO versatile featuring a sweet built-in bar, knotty pine paneling and classic tiled floors if you want to live the space as a rumpus room or you could use the downstairs as a huge, tucked-in primary bedroom with a bathroom. Proper egress and a large storage room allow you to choose what works best for you. Central A/C and gas heat will keep you cozy year round. Outside, discover an absolute gardener's delight with so many lush plantings, blueberries, raspberries, a variety of trees, a greenhouse, and tool shed. Backyard Habitat Silver certification in progress! Plenty of garden space, an irrigation system and primed rich soil are ready for spring planting. Ask your broker to download the plant and shrub list available in RMLS! The fully fenced yard and patio area provide nice privacy and a quiet place to call your own. Situated in a vibrant, welcoming and community-driven neighborhood with great amenities such as the St Johns Food Cart pod, farmers market, great restaurants and eclectic local shops and a near-by New Seasons. Local attractions include Cathedral Park, the University of Portland, close access to Forest Park and the iconic St Johns Bridge. Walk and Bike Score 90+ and Tri-Met is nearby, too.

Public Remarks: Situated on just under a quarter acre, this corner lot sits high above street level in the beautiful Cathedral Park neighborhood. Surrounding the property, the mature landscaping immediately impresses, providing privacy along with ample space for various outdoor activities, such as gardening or outdoor entertainment. The house, originally built in 1919, has undergone a significant amount of upgrades. Walking up to the front entry, you are greeted by a large covered front deck with expansive views of Forest Park and the Willamette River. Inside, the home has preserved a large amount of the original architectural elements, including vintage windows, hardwood floors, doors, and built-in features. High ceilings and natural light flood through the home at all levels, adding to its appeal. The floor plan offers seamless flow through the living room, dining room, and kitchen. The kitchen is excellent, featuring incredible upgrades with beautiful granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, expansive cabinet space, and a large window letting natural light into the kitchen. The bedroom on the main level has a large built-in with a Murphy bed, closet, and exterior entry, making it perfect for guests or as a permanent bedroom. Upstairs, two large bedrooms with walk-in closets, two full bathrooms, and a bonus room provide ample space for various bedroom arrangements. In the lower level, the unfinished basement has potential for additional finished space, whether for additional bedrooms, a laundry room, or bonus rooms. Currently, it includes built-in storage features, washer/dryer hookups, and extra storage space. In the backyard, enjoy the privacy of a large covered porch, a tool shed, and a fully fenced yard, complete with raised garden beds and a wide variety of mature fruit trees including apples, plums, figs, artichokes, and blueberry bushes. The home is in close proximity to St. John's, offering easy access to great restaurants, shops, schools, and other amenities.

Public Remarks: Gorgeous newer construction perfectly situated on a corner lot in the heart of beloved Kenton. This home features 3 spacious bedrooms and 2.1 baths, an open-concept kitchen and family room, and a two-car garage. French doors lead to a private backyard, ideal for year-round entertaining with its covered patio and lush green space. Inside, a charming wood-burning fireplace adds warmth and ambiance. This well-maintained home is move-in ready and waiting for its next chapter.Located in North Portland, the Kenton neighborhood is a thriving, close-knit community known for its iconic 31-foot statue of Paul Bunyan. The area offers a vibrant mix of residential charm and urban amenities, including the Portland Metropolitan Expo Center and the Portland International Raceway. Kenton is home to friendly, hardworking residents who take pride in their neighborhood. With nearly 2,200 acres and approximately 7,000 residents, Kenton offers space, character, and potential.Outdoor lovers enjoy easy access to numerous parks including Kenton City Park, Trenton Park, Peninsula Park, and Arbor Lodge Park. These green spaces offer basketball courts, soccer fields, walking paths, playgrounds, picnic areas, tennis courts, and even an outdoor pool.Families love Kenton for its excellent Portland public schoolsPeninsular Elementary, Ockley Green Middle, and Roosevelt High. With over 25% of residents under 17, its truly family-friendly.Denver Avenue, Kentons main thoroughfare, is dotted with locally-owned restaurants, shops, pubs, and cafes. With close proximity to I-5 and just 10 minutes to downtown, Kenton is perfectly located for work and play. Home styles range from Craftsman to Bungalow to Old Portland, many beautifully restored. Alive, vibrant, and full of charmKenton is a Portland gem.

Portlands so-called Fifth Quadrant is a lively patchwork of commercial districts, natural spaces and residential areas. Its home to some of the citys most charming neighborhoods, including St. Johns, Mississippi, Williams and Kenton. NoPo also boasts striking landmarks and unique attractions, like Cathedral Park, the historic St. Johns Bridge, and the Smith and Bybee Wetlands Natural Area. The Portsmouth neighborhood is very bike friendly with several parks, restaurants including a great selection of food trucks. Its a safe neighborhood that is great for families, University of Portland students or professionals who want the small town feel in the big city.Portsmouth is tucked between two charming neighborhoods with downtown shops, restaurants and plenty of neighborhood events. The Kenton and St. Johns farmers markets are a weekly event from Spring to Fall. The Sunday Parkways in the N Portland area is the last Sunday of June featuring several spots in the Portsmouth neighborhood.
